metadata.titel_preek: The Messiah Comes to His Temple

locutie.beschrijving: The preacher explains the prophetic tradition of God's judgment on religious hypocrisy, contextualizes Jesus' cleansing of the temple as a Messianic claim, and links the 'temple of his body' to the cross.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. Strong integration of Malachi, Isaiah, and Amos with the Johannine narrative.

illocutie.beschrijving: The force shifts from historical description to a direct confrontation of the hearer's religious idols, culminating in a promise of grace through Christ's sacrifice.
voorbeelden: I know that I stand under judgment.
Now hear this.
The summons goes out to you.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: Repentance, stripping of religious self-righteousness, and trust in the substitutionary work of Christ.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit. The preacher assumes the word has power but does not explicitly invoke the Spirit's agency.

voorbeelden: Jesus was not just a generic religious figure.
This prophetic tradition had two features.
The Episcopal church is a classic example.
Take these things away.
Let us go nearer and listen.
Join with the first disciples.
These passages make me very nervous.
I have flunked Lent.
We may be thankful for the reminder.
He will not let us go until we are as righteous as he is.
He goes to lay down his own life... on my behalf.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strong theological grounding, though often framed in the 3rd person.

voorbeelden: Now hear this.
The good news... is that the Messiah with the whip is the Lamb of God.
The summons goes out to you.
declaratieven.autoriteit: Moderate; relies on the authority of the 'Word' rather than a direct 'I absolve you'.

indicatoren: Extensive historical background on the 'historical Jesus' and Jewish context.
Long lists of modern church activities (ATM, Yoga, etc.) that describe rather than address.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is well-informed and intellectually engaged but remains an observer for the first two-thirds of the sermon.

missende_elementen: Immediate sacramental 'I' language from the preacher as God's mandatory.
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The 'event' is delayed until the final movement.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: High; the shift to 'on my behalf' and 'for you' creates a genuine encounter.
voorbeelden: This same Jesus... is also the one who is on his way... on my behalf.
The summons goes out to you.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Used for preacher's self-disclosure ('I flunked Lent') to build solidarity.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address to the congregation's idols and the final summons.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used effectively in the 'refiner's fire' application.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Dominates the historical and exegetical sections.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a 'lecture' feel in the first half.

verleden_tijd.gebruik: Biblical history and the 33 A.D. narrative.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General theological truths about human nature and sin.

actueel_present.gebruik: The 'Now hear this' moment and the current Holy Week context.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from the judgment of the Law (Assertive) to the Promise of the Gospel (Commissive) to the call to believe (Directive).
voorbeelden: We are under judgment -> He dies on my behalf -> Believe the word.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Because he is the Lamb... the summons goes out to you.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: Despite a constative surplus in the beginning, the sermon successfully transitions into a performative event by the end, where the word 'happens' to the hearer.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: I have flunked Lent. I flunk it every year.
sterke_punten.effect: Breaks the distance between the 'expert' preacher and the 'sinful' hearer.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: When Jesus came among us in the first century A.D., he came in a specific historical context.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Too much 'talking about' the past before bringing it into the present.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon becomes an event when it identifies the hearer's pew as the one being overturned.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The 'Toezegging' (Promise) is clear: Christ's body is the new temple for us.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Yes, especially in the final summons.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Yes, the preacher speaks as one delivering a 'summons'.
tekstueel_bewijs: The summons goes out to you.

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicitly left to the hearer's response.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, the sermon is treated as the 'blazing light' in which we see ourselves.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: Yes, the 'refiner's fire' imagery is used epiphanically.
tekstueel_bewijs: In his blazing light we see ourselves.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon relies heavily on 'to be' and 'to have' in the first half. It needs more 'I promise' and 'I declare' verbs.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: This passage means that when the Messiah comes it is going to hurt.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: The Messiah is here now, and his fire is melting away your defenses.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a general truth to a present-tense event.

toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Maintain the current strength of the Gospel turn.
voorbeeldzinnen: I announce to you that Christ has passed through the fire for you.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: The 'we' in the middle section is sometimes too general.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Use 'you' more pointedly during the Law section.
voorbeeldzinnen: It is your idol that he is stripping away.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: The balance is already quite good.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A powerful example of how a sermon can move from a lecture to a sacramental encounter. The preacher's vulnerability is the bridge to the performative.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' about flunking Lent; SAT sees this as a felicity condition for the Declarative of grace.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric would praise the 'Handel' illustration; SAT asks if the illustration serves the Illocution of 'Promising'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's power isn't in the description of the 33 A.D. temple, but in the Commissive act where Christ's body is given to the hearer today.

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully avoids moralism by grounding the 'summons' in the 'indicative' of Christ's finished work.
